name: Dry Shampoo
description:
Directions:

Rub the Dry Shampoo into your dog's coat with a towel. Pay most attention to the areas of the body that are dirtiest or greasiest. Brush treated areas thoroughly until all of the grain mixture is removed.


*All Natural and Organic*
Tested on Katie, our Havanese. :)

A Little Bit About This Product:

If your dog resists a regular soapy water bath, dry shampoo is a great solution. Dry shampoo spot-cleans greasy, dirty areas of your dog's coat.

name: Herbal Flea Powder
description:
Directions:

Sprinkle the powder onto your dog's coat and use your hand or a comb to get the fleas out. Do this outside to prevent the powder and fleas from getting inside your house.

*All Natural and Organic*
Tested on Katie, our Havanese. :)

A Little Bit About This Product:

There are a lot of flea products on the market, but all of them are dangerous to your dog because it has chemicals in them. Our Herbal Flea Powder repels fleas and it doesn't harm your dog.

name: Lemon Flea Tonic
description:
Directions:

Sponge the Lemon Flea Tonic onto your dog's coat.

*All Natural and Organic*
Tested on Katie, our Havanese. :)

A Little Bit About This Product:

D-limonene is a natural flea killer. It is so mild that it can be used daily, if the problem is severe.

name: Rosemary Flea Tonic
description:
Directions:

Pour the solution over your dog's coat after his final rinse and pat him dry with a towel.

*All natural and organic*
Tested on Katie, our Havanese. :)

A Little Bit About This Product:

Use this after baths to make your dog's coat soft and shiny. Rosemary adds a pleasant scent to his coat.

Directions:
